moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4: The 3. d4 move makes this an "Open Sicilian" game, often characterised as giving rise to very complicated positions
moves.3... Nf6: 3. ..cxd4 is the more common continuation here, but Nf6 is an excellent move
moves.4. dxc5: 4. Nc3 or 4. Bb5+ are both somewhat better here, at least played more often. I would say that white loses a tempo of development
moves.5. cxd6: Probably the best. Now the position is as open as it could possibly be!
moves.5... Nc6: This is probably better than Nxd6, as it favours development
moves.6. Bd3: A sound developing move. Nbd2 and Be3 also being possible
moves.7. Nc3: A logical development. c3 and 0-0 were also possible. The position is quite even at this point, which means that White has lost their natural beginner's advantage
moves.7... e6: Fianchettoing the BSB (black square bishop) with g6 here was probably a better strategy here
moves.9. Bf4 O-O 10. a3 Nf5 11. Ne4 h6 12. Qd2: A good move, even though 12. ...g5! might have been still better
moves.13. Nxd4 Qxd4: This is more aggressive and much better than Nxd4
moves.14. g4: This is a blunder as it poses no significant threat or gain but seriously weakens White's king position. 14. c3 was the simplest continuation
moves.14... Nh4: This is a very good move that immediately takes advantage of White's mistake
moves.15. Qe2 Qxb2: This is "greedy". 15. ...f5! had been the strongest continuation of the king side attack
moves.16. g5: A very good move in this position, although Bg3 was also alright
moves.16... hxg5: Bxg5 or g6 had been much better
moves.17. Bxg5: This is a mistake. Nxg5 would have equalised the position
moves.17... Bxg5 18. Nxg5 g6: Excellent move! Note that 18. ...Nf5 19. Bxf5 exf5 20. Qh5! is winning for White
moves.19. Rfe1: This is a blunder that probably loses the game. Be4 had been a reasonable continuation
moves.19... Qf6: Precisely! Now Black has a winning game. White loses their piece or Black checks with Nf3.
moves.20... Qxf4 21. Nh3 Qf3 22. Ref1: Ng5 had yielded less damage. Now the game is over in practise
moves.22... Qxh3 23. Be4 e5: f5 was a somewhat better possibiity
